intro: Siphocranion macranthum var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved siphocranion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, narrow leaves that are often densely arranged along the stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
